Job Summary

Candidate will be a team member of the RESEARCH ADMINISTRATION within the Department of Emergency Medicine. Candidate should have a clear potential of a distinguished record of scholarship, and demonstrate potential for collaborative and interdisciplinary work with a focus on statistical analytics and modeling. Candidate will assist with gathering and interpretation of data and collaborate with Emergency Medicine faculty on grants and manuscripts. Specifically, candidate will conduct research using statistical analytics and modeling, publish and present results, secure extramural funding in the co-investigator or principal investigator role.

Required Qualifications*

PhD is required. Previous research work experience using statistical analytics and modeling. Strong record of high quality research manuscripts/publications as first or senior author is also required.

Background Screening

Michigan Medicine conducts background screening and pre-employment drug testing on job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent job offer and may use a third party administrator to conduct background screenings. Background screenings are performed in compliance with the Fair Credit Report Act.
